keyFacts: The documents are routine Bureau of Prisons (BOP) staff training records from March and April 2019, predating Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019.

Training topics included whistleblower protections, weapons of mass destruction, continuity of operations, PREA (Prison Rape Elimination Act), domestic violence, information security, managing inmates with disabilities, and firearms qualification.

The records list numerous staff members from various departments (Custody, Psychology, Business Office, etc.), but most names are illegible signatures, redacted, or only first names/initials are shown.
The firearms score sheets indicate staff were tested on weapons including 9mm, M16, 12-gauge shotgun, and submachine guns.
The documents originate from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, where Jeffrey Epstein was later held and died.
